questions.question: The Facility Association is:
options: An industry plan designed to guarantee availability of insurance for all automobile owners that cannot obtain coverage in the open market
An industry plan designed to guarantee availability of automobile insurance for all personal risks but never offers coverage for commercial automobile risks
An auto plan run by the Government
An automobile insurance plan run by the Brokers Association of Canada

questions.question: The Automobile Insurance policy under Section C – Loss or Damage to Insured Automobile provides coverage for a temporary substitute automobile. Which statement most closely defines a temporary substitute automobile?
options: An automobile not owned by the Insured or other household residents, temporarily driven
An automobile owned by the Insured, driven occasionally
An automobile not owned by the Insured, but owned by his dependent son
An automobile owned by the Insured, only driven when damaged vehicle is being repaired

questions.question: Statutory Condition 4 “Requirements Where Loss or Damage to the Automobile” in the S.P.F. No. 1 states that the Insured is required to do the following after an accident:
options: Have the damage to the automobile appraised and repaired within 30 days
Protect the vehicle from further loss or damage at the insured’s expense
Protect the vehicle from further loss or damage at the insurer’s expense
Turn the salvage over to the insurer before the loss has been settled

questions.question: Under the S.P.F. No. 1 – Section C – Additional Agreements of Insurer, the insurer agrees to waive subrogation against every person who, with the Insured’s consent, has care, custody or control of the automobile except:
options: Without restriction
Except for someone who sells or repairs cars
A person who is a member of the insured’s family residing in the same household
A person who is a friend of a family member

questions.question: The S.P.F. No. 6 Non-Owned Policy is intended to provide coverage to:
options: A business whose owned cars are provided to and driven by their salesmen
A business that does not own any vehicles but pays employees mileage when driving their own vehicles for business
A business whose owned vehicles are driven by any of their employees
A business whose owned vehicles are driven by officers, directors, and shareholders

questions.question: The S.P.F. No. 2 Driver’s Policy is specifically designed for:
options: The owner of a business who provides vehicles for the use of their salespeople
The passenger in a vehicle driven by another person
The pedestrian who is hit and injured by a driver who does not own the vehicle
A person who drives vehicles owned and licensed by others

questions.question: The S.P.F. No. 4 is specifically tailored to meet the needs of:
options: The same risks as the S.P.F. No. 1 Owner’s Policy
Garage, dealer, or body shop automobile businesses
Legal liability for collision to customers’ vehicles
All of the above

questions.question: Under the Standard Owner’s Form S.P.F. No. 1, which of the following uses, unless permission is given by the insurer, are prohibited regardless?
options: Carrying explosives
Carrying passengers for compensation
Rental or lease of the automobile
Any race or speed test

questions.question: The Standard Endorsement Form No. 20 is:
options: Family Protection Endorsement
Permission to drive non-owned automobiles
Loss of Use Endorsement
Valued Automobile(s) Endorsement

questions.question: Which of the following endorsements is required to be added to a client’s automobile policy is they purchased their vehicle in a “hail sale”?
options: SEF 13D
SEF 40
SEF 27
SEF 13H

questions.question: Which of the following endorsements are required to provide Section C coverage to a non-owned vehicle when it is being used and the insured vehicle is not broken down, lost, destroyed, or sold?
options: SEF 20
SEF 27
SEF 30
SEF 44

questions.question: The Insured is hit by a third party who ran a traffic light while impaired. Witnesses confirm the Insured had the green light. How will the SEF 44 respond?
options: It will indemnify absolute liability only
It will respond to the Insured’s injury damages after the initial $200,000, up to the policy limit
It will pay all of the Insured’s injuries
It will pay all property damage limited by absolute liability requirements

questions.question: An Insured allows their 8-year-old son to operate a quad. The S.P.F. No. 1 provides coverage for unlicensed, unqualified, or underage drivers while the quad is used off public highways provided:
options: An SEF 32 is endorsed to the policy
An SEF 40 is endorsed to the policy
The quad is not being operated across a lake
The quad is not being operated without a helmet

questions.question: Your insured is renting a vehicle while on vacation in Florida and carries Section A, Section B, and Section C Subsections 2 and 3. All of the following coverages extend to the rental vehicle except:
options: Damage to the hotel when the insured drives into it
Damage to the hotel concierge when the insured drives into them
Injury to the insured’s son in the backseat when the insured drives into the hotel
Damage to the rental vehicle when the insured drives into the hotel

questions.question: Your insured carries an SPF 1 with an SEF 20 and Collision coverage. While driving in the USA, his vehicle is involved in an accident. How will the SEF 20 respond?
options: Immediate rental vehicle coverage plus hotel costs
Rental vehicle coverage after 72 hours plus hotel costs
Immediate rental vehicle coverage if undriveable; hotel costs are not covered
Coverage depends on the insurance company wording

questions.question: A man owns a vehicle and wants to insure it for his wife to drive daily. How should the policy be written?
options: In both names
In her name since she is the main driver
In his name as owner with his wife rated as principal driver
In both names with him as principal driver

questions.question: The SEF 30 limits liability damage from an auto policy, making it CGL for attached equipment. Which endorsement limits physical damage to the attached equipment itself and makes it Commercial Property Insurance?
options: SEF 20
SEF 27
SEF 30A
There is no endorsement

questions.question: Transportation Network Auto Policy for ride-share operators (e.g., Uber) works as follows:
options: The insured is on their own SPF #1 until passengers are accepted
The insured SPF #1 is suspended while engaged in ride-share activity
Losses while the app is active with passengers are covered under SPF #9
All of the above statements are true

questions.question: Section C of an SPF #4 Garage Policy differs from SPF #1 primarily because:
options: There are no differences
All Perils is not available under SPF #4
Collision is not offered for customers’ vehicles
None of the above

questions.question: Which of the following businesses require an SPF #4?
options: A dry cleaner delivering clothes
A car detailing and alarm installation company
A hotel with valet parking
A self-serve car wash
B and C

questions.question: Which statement is FALSE regarding the standard auto application?
options: A full vehicle description is required
The intent is to establish territory of use
Annual driving distance is required
After-market modifications are requested

questions.question: Under Third Party Liability (Section A), the insured agrees to:
options: Reimburse the insurer for absolute liability payments
Investigate, negotiate, and settle claims
Reimburse the insurer for medical aid expenses
Advise the insurer which law firm they choose
